items.q: The young children in the school ____________________ under the guidance of their supportive and nurturing teachers.
After a number of ____________________ encounters with his neighbors, Gary decided to find a new apartment and move.
Although Anna's health was quite ____________________ after her illness, she was hopeful about making a full recovery.
The citizens were relieved when the city's most ____________________ criminal was finally put in jail.
The newspaper article ____________________ the fact that the newly elected mayor had no previous experience in local government.
My little brother threw a snowball at me yesterday. Today, in ____________________, I attacked him with snowballs as he got off the school bus.
The consequence for ____________________ in many workplaces is immediate dismissal.
His car loan payment ____________________ one month from the date he purchased the car.
The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and just not ____________________ (thinking / think) about your age. —Lucille Ball
If fitness ____________________ (came / were coming) in a bottle, everybody would have a great body. —Cher
It is ____________________ (dangerously / dangerous) to be right when the government is wrong. —Voltaire
The next best thing to knowing the answer is ____________________ (know / knowing) where to find it. —Samuel Johnson
When one's diet is wrong, medicine is of no use. When your diet is ____________________ (correct / correctly), medicine is of no need. —Ancient Chinese Proverb
(1) a. them b. it c. us
(2) a. realized b. realize c. had realized
(3) a. disinteresting b. disinterested c. disinterest
(4) a. wants b. want c. wanted
(5) a. more friendly b. more friendlier c. friendlier
(6) a. he b. it c. they
(7) a. visit b. visited c. have visited
(8) a. ridiculously b. ridiculous c. ridicule
(9) a. I b. we c. they
(10) a. could b. should c. has to
Which topic is the better choice for a research paper? a. Pros and cons of paying college athletes b. Famous college athletes
Which topic is the better choice for a research paper? a. Standardized testing b. Alternatives to college placement exams
Which topic is the better choice for a research paper? a. Universal health care coverage b. Affordable health care options for the elderly
Which topic is the better choice for a research paper? a. Juvenile crime cases b. Effectiveness in juvenile delinquency prevention programs
Which topic is the better choice for a research paper? a. The purpose of the layered ecosystem of the rainforest b. Rainforests around the world

Flynn, N., & Kahn, R. (2003). E-mail rules: A business guide to managing policies, security, and legal issues for e-mail and digital communications . American Management Association: New York . a. Flynn, N., b. (2003). c. New York
H. Belloc (1926). Napoleon's campaign of 1812 and the retreat from Moscow . New York: Harper. a. H. Belloc b. Napoleon's campaign of 1812 and the retreat from Moscow. c. Harper.

(2005). Hiltz, S., & Shea, P. The student in the online classroom. In S. Hiltz & R. Goldman (Eds.), Learning together online: Research on asynchronous learning networks (pp. 145–168). Mahwah, NJ: Erlbaum. a. (2005). b. Shea, P. c. Mahwah, NJ:
Layard, R. (2005) . Happiness: Lessons from a new science. New York: Penguin. a. (2005). b. Happiness: Lessons from a new science. c. New York:

Ewen, J., Armstrong, D., Parker, K., & Seddon, P. (2012). Oxford: Wiley-Blackwell. Reintroduction biology: Integrating science and management . a. Ewen, J., Armstrong, D., Parker, K., & Seddon, P. b. (2012). c. Oxford: Wiley-Blackwell.
a person, group, or country associated with another for a common purpose
a belief
a final demand from one person or group that the other side must agree to in order to avoid a heavy penalty
a government order to prohibit the movement of ships into or out of a port
a person who robs at sea
an edge or outside limit
a story that has been repeated many times but cannot be verified
someone who works for a government to discover secrets of the other side
Freeman, J. (2009). The tyranny of e-mail: The four-thousand-year journey to your inbox . New York: Scribner. __________
Seymour, W. The price of folly: British blunders in the War of American Independence . (1995). London: Brassey's. __________
Martin, M. 2012. Happiness and the good life . Oxford: Oxford University Press. __________
Delgado, J. (2008). Khubilai Khan’s lost fleet: In search of a legendary armada . Berkeley, CA: University of California Press. __________
Dickens, M. (1972). New York: Macmillan. The world of butterflies. __________
You may pay in cash at the farmer's market—no other form of payment is accepting. __________
Only the criminal and the witness know exactly what happened, but the criminal is refusing to speak. __________
How much people pay for health insurance. __________
Ethnic groups each have their own customs, enjoy cooking, and traditions. __________
The customer had been so insulted by the attendant that she sent a strongly-worded letter to the corporate office to complain about the incident. __________
Finding out about an author's background is one way to determine if you should use his or her source in your research paper. __________
Peer-reviewed sources are high quality because they cannot be published until the work is assessed by experts. __________
When you are looking for a reputable source, sources on the Internet are preferred more than peer-reviewed journals. __________
A current source is considered to be anything written within the past fifty years. __________
A timely source is one that is up to date and relevant. __________
This References list is organized in date order. __________
Two of the entries were published in the same city. __________
All of the entries in this References list are books. __________
The most recent books in this References list were published in 2003. __________
One book in this References list has more than one author. __________

Look at the three topics. Choose one that interests you. Follow the guidelines you have practiced in Great Writing 5 to write an essay that is suitable for a research paper. Topic 1: Compare and/or contrast the educational system in your country to the one in the United States. Topic 2: What are the effects of knowing (or not knowing) a second language? Topic 3: Think about censorship on the Internet. Is it necessary? Why or why not?
